description: Bolivia is among the world’s most politically turbulent nations, having experienced nearly 200 revolutions and coups or coup attempts since it won independence from Spain two centuries ago. The latest was a June 26 effort to overthrow unpopular President Luis Arce, a left-wing economist. Arce served as finance minister for over a decade earlier this century, during Bolivia’s boom years, but now presides over a country experiencing a harsh economic crisis.
title: Why Bolivia Descended Into Yet Another Coup Attempt

description: Mongolians will head to the polls on Friday to vote for a new parliament, with many looking for a party best-suited to deliver on promises of sharing mining wealth and cracking down on entrenched corruption.
title: Mongolians Head to Polls for Country’s Biggest-Ever Election

description: France and Germany are used to getting their way on the EU stage. But when the bloc’s two biggest economies turned up at Thursday’s crucial European Union summit distracted by their own domestic troubles, they found it harder to throw their weight around.
title: Macron and Scholz’s Summit Hijack Hits a Wall of Angry EU Leaders

description: Polls put Britain's Labour Party on course for a huge majority after 14 years in opposition - but the honeymoon after July 4 could be fleeting
title: Starmer Builds a Big UK Election Victory on a Volatile Coalition

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green previews the first Biden-Trump debate of 2024. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden and Trump Set to Step Into the Ring for Round One

description: Mexico’s finance minister met with investors in London this week to reassure them that President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum will moderate the impact of a planned judicial overhaul and reach its goal for a smaller deficit, according to people with knowledge of the discussions.
title: Mexico’s Finance Minister Pledges Moderation in London Meetings

description: As rebel Bolivian soldiers occupied La Paz’s central plaza and drove an armored vehicle into the government palace on Wednesday, panicked citizens rushed to withdraw cash, fill their cars with gas and stock up on food.
title: Bolivians Raced to Hoard Cash as Army Rebels Attacked Palace

description: A US Senate committee is investigating whether oil producers are illegally coordinating with OPEC to raise prices, following allegations that the former head of Pioneer Natural Resources Co. colluded with the cartel.
title: Senate Probes Possibility of Collusion Between Big Oil and OPEC

description: President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum appointed a close ally to lead the Energy Ministry, which will be key to expand power generation for Mexico’s industrialization push.
title: Sheinbaum Names Ally Luz Elena Gonzalez as Energy Minister

description: Donors to Donald Trump paid $25,000 to pose a question in a virtual fundraiser to North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum — one of the top contenders to be the presumptive Republican nominee’s running mate.
title: Trump Donors Pay $25,000 to Ask Doug Burgum Questions on Zoom

description: The stock market has largely brushed off the uncertainty around November’s US election. That may change Thursday evening, when President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump face off in the first debate in the race.
title: EV, Chips, Crypto Stocks in Crosshairs as Biden, Trump Face Off

description: French President Emmanuel Macron plans to reappoint Thierry Breton as France’s EU Commissioner, Le Monde reports, citing unidentified people familiar.
title: Macron to Reappoint Breton as French EU Commissioner: Monde

description: There are seven days to go until the election. The Conservatives slipped fractionally to 20.1%, extending a run of record lows with Labour comfortably 20 points ahead, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Allegra Stratton and Helen Chandler-Wilde: The End is In Sight

description: The US Supreme Court scheduled Monday as a new opinion day — and signaled the term will continue beyond then — as the justices wind down a session that includes a clash over President Donald Trump’s bid for criminal immunity.
title: Supreme Court Sets Monday for Opinions Amid Wait for Trump Case

description: Two members from the youth wing of Giorgia Meloni’s party have resigned from their posts after they were caught on camera making remarks that officials judged to be racist and antisemitic.
title: Meloni’s Party Sees Officials Quit After Racist Jokes on Camera

description: Germany is pushing European Union leaders to drop language on joint defense spending, a stance that’s triggering resistance from other member states that believe extra resources are needed to ramp up the bloc’s capabilities.
title: Germany Irks EU Leaders by Opposing Talks on How to Fund Defense

description: The booming private credit market is of growing concern to the top enforcement official at the US Securities and Exchange Commission.
title: SEC’s Top Cop Concerned About Private Credit Valuations, Opacity

description: Israel’s Supreme Court ruled on June 25 that the military must start conscripting ultra-Orthodox Jews. The ruling ends an exemption that goes back to the state’s founding. It is putting pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition government as Israel fights a war in Gaza and is likely to start a process of profound change for the country’s 1.3 million ultra-Orthodox, also known as Haredim. If they start to serve in the army, some may leave the fold.
title: Why Israel’s Court Ordered the Conscription of Ultra-Orthodox Men

description: President Javier Milei is on the cusp of clinching his biggest political victory since taking office, with lawmakers likely to give final approval to two proposals meant to resuscitate Argentina’s crisis-prone economy.
title: Milei’s Reforms Set to Cross Finish Line in Argentina’s Congress

description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner said it could be illegal for the European Central Bank to intervene if the French legislative election triggers a dangerous selloff in the country’s government bonds.
title: Germany May Object If ECB Moves to Lower French Bond Yields

description: Switzerland and the US have tightened the automatic exchange of bank information, making it harder for American citizens to keep their account data from getting into the hands of US tax authorities.
title: Swiss Widen Bank Data Sharing With US in Tax Dodging Clampdown

description: Germany, Poland and the Czech Republic asked the European Union for financial support to help cover the cost of hosting Ukrainian refugees since the three countries have taken in the lion’s share since Russia’s invasion.
title: Germany, Poland Ask EU to Help Pay for Hosting Ukraine Refugees

description: Keir Starmer is teeing up plans for billions of pounds worth of new private investment in Britain in the first few months of a Labour government — a surge that the opposition party hopes is large enough to meet its ambitious growth goals and avoid tax hikes if it wins next week’s election.
title: Labour Banks on Billions of Private Investment After UK Election

description: Boston residents face a sharp increase in property taxes or risk $400 million of budget cuts if state lawmakers reject a plan to shift the burden to commercial buildings, Mayor Michelle Wu said in an interview with Bloomberg News.
title: Boston Office Slump Sets Up $400 Million Burden for Residents

description: The area planted with the raw ingredient used to make cocaine in the world’s No. 2 producer fell for the first time in years, Peruvian authorities said Wednesday.
title: Production of Cocaine Ingredient Falls in World’s No. 2 Producer

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy signed an agreement for a long-term security commitment with the European Union as western allies pledge to maintain military and political support for Kyiv.
title: Ukraine Wins EU Security Deal as Zelenskiy Joins Leaders’ Summit

description: The expected success of Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally party in France’s parliamentary election this week will be no obstacle to the UK’s ability to build closer ties with Europe, according to Keir Starmer, who polls suggest will become UK prime minister after the July 4 UK vote.
title: France’s Shift to the Right Won’t Inhibit UK Ties, Starmer Says

description: Two of the most conservative candidates in Iran’s presidential election have stepped aside, leaving four men, including the poll’s sole reformist option, contesting Friday’s vote.
title: Two Hard Line Candidates Withdraw from Iran’s Presidential Race

description: A senior Labour Party lawmaker has urged caution against taking a binary approach to China, brushing back political pressure in the UK to clamp down on Beijing.
title: UK Can’t Have ‘Binary’ Approach to China, Labour’s Reynolds Says

description: Donald Trump’s from-the-hip style may start making financial markets volatile again — and that’s just fine for a breed of global fast-money traders who thrive on that.
title: ‘Volatile and Unpredictable’: Why Fast-Money Traders Like Trump

description: The Metropolitan Police said they would investigate a “small number” of bets made on the timing of the UK general election, raising the stakes in a scandal that has dogged Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives in the run-up to next week’s vote.
title: UK Police to Probe Election Bets in Inside-Information Scandal

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: One Week To Go: Our Election Panel Counts Down

description: Leaders from Poland and the Baltic states implored the European Union to step up support for an initiative to bolster defenses on the bloc’s eastern frontier.
title: Poland, Baltic States Urge EU to Spend on Eastern Border Defense

description: The European Union should postpone a regulation to tackle deforestation beyond its borders and use the time for a revision that would reduce the bureaucratic burden, according to senior European Parliament member Peter Liese.
title: EU Should Delay Deforestation Regulation, Senior Lawmaker Says

description: In the months that followed its invasion of Ukraine and punitive Western restrictions imposed in response, Russia amassed a shadow fleet to ferry its oil around the world. Now there is growing evidence Moscow has begun to do the same for liquefied natural gas.
title: After Oil, Russia May Now Be Building a Shadow Fleet for Gas

description: A Pakistani court upheld the last of Imran Khan’s jail sentences, dealing a blow to the former prime minister who has been in prison for about nine months and faces dozens of other court cases.
title: Pakistan Court Upholds Imran Khan’s Conviction in Wedding Case

description: Talks between South Africa’s two biggest political parties on forming a cabinet stalled after the African National Congress withdrew an offer to appoint a member of the smaller Democratic Alliance as trade and industry minister, people familiar with the matter said.
title: South Africa Cabinet Talks Stall After ANC Withdraws Trade Offer

description: China’s ruling Communist Party expelled two former defense ministers on corruption charges, ending speculation over their fate after a spate of purges rocked the nation’s defense universe.
title: China Ousts Two Ex-Defense Ministers from Party on Corruption

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives continued their slide in Bloomberg’s UK poll of polls as the Liberal Democrats hit their highest rating of the campaign, a reminder that the threat to the governing party doesn’t just come from the insurgent right-wingers in Nigel Farage’s Reform UK party.
title: New Tory Low as Liberal Democrats Gain, Poll of Polls Shows

description: Taiwan has hiked its travel warning for China to the second-highest level, as tensions between the two sides ramp up under the island’s new president.
title: Taiwan Warns Against Non-Essential Travel to China, HK, Macau

description: Muted mics, criminal convictions — here’s what to know about the historic showdown between a sitting and former president.
title: What to Watch in Biden and Trump’s First Presidential Debate of 2024

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Economic Insecurity Roils Politics From Kenya to France

description: South Africa’s currency fell the most in emerging markets Thursday, leading a selloff in the nation’s assets, amid growing anxiety over delays to the formation of President Cyril Ramaphosa’s Cabinet.
title: Rand Resumes Losses as South Africa Cabinet Delay Fuels Angst

description: With France’s far-right National Rally expected to secure the most votes in a parliamentary election on Sunday, there’s a lot more at stake than the liberal, pro-business reform agenda of centrist President Emmanuel Macron. Here’s a guide to the election, showing how the rise of the anti-immigrant party led by Marine Le Pen is putting France’s unique political system under strain.
title: Macron? Le Pen? A Guide to France’s Crucial Election

description: The president needs a big victory in Pennsylvania’s largest city to win the crucial state.
title: Democrats Keep Feuding in Philly, Imperiling Biden's Reelection

description: A junta-controlled court in Myanmar has set a rebidding for Aung San Suu Kyi’s family mansion in Yangon in August at a lower floor price after an auction earlier this year failed to draw any offers.
title: Suu Kyi’s Family Mansion Will Be Up for Bidding Again in August

description: How "Made In China" first became a thing
title: The American Entrepreneurs Who First Opened The Chinese Market

description: China said two pandas are on their way to a zoo in the US, a sign relations between the nations are improving despite their differences over a range of issues including trade.
title: China Says Two Pandas Are Heading to US in Show of ‘Friendship’

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally has strengthened its lead ahead of the first round of France’s snap legislative election on Sunday, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Bloomberg French Poll of Polls: Le Pen’s Group Makes More Gains

description: North Korea’s trash balloons can pose a threat to flights, an aviation official cautioned, a day after South Korea’s busiest airport temporarily halted operations when at least one balloon landed on the tarmac.
title: North Korea's Trash Balloons Are Putting Planes in Danger, South Korean Aviation Official Warns

description: Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said French state coffers have been strengthened by higher-than-expected tax earnings, projecting more optimism about the economy just days before the first round of legislative elections.
title: Le Maire Says France Pulled in Extra €3 Billion in Tax Receipts

description: British companies lifted wages at the fastest pace since January in postings for jobs they have open, a source of lingering inflationary pressure that may complicate the case for an interest-rate cut.
title: UK Pay Offered in Indeed Job Postings Rises Most Since January

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will convene senior officials for a long-delayed conclave from July 15 to 18, as investors closely watch for signs of policy pivots in the world’s second-largest economy.
title: China to Hold Delayed Party Meeting on Reform From July 15 to 18

description: Finance chieftains are once again looking to invest in London as political turmoil in France and the US make the UK look more competitive on the global stage, according to the chief executive officer of a top London lobbying group.
title: Top Lobbyist Sees London Gaining Edge With France, US Elections

description: An overwhelming majority of participants in a Thai government survey have backed the Southeast Asian nation’s plan to reclassify cannabis as a narcotics to prohibit its recreational use.
title: Majority of Thais Back Plan to Label Cannabis as Narcotics Again

description: Thailand has wrapped up a complex process of selecting its new 200-member Senate, which will be less powerful than the outgoing upper house with some former military and police officers and academics emerging as winners.
title: Former Generals, Academics Emerge Winners in Thai Senate Race

description: Funds managed by the Australian group made about £1.65 billion in a decade. The heavily indebted British water company is now on the verge of collapse — and the next government faces pressure to rescue it.
title: Macquarie Borrowed Big. Now 16 Million Thames Water Users Are Picking Up the Bill

description: A forever conflict won’t bring back the “startup nation.”
title: Just Wars Can Still Be Bad Wars: A Response to Readers on Gaza

description: The nation’s unrelenting dry spell is ushering in record wheat imports and risking fruit and vegetable sales abroad.
title: Drought Gripping Morocco Is Bad Omen for Global Food Supplies

description: Global trade tariffs were top of mind for attendees at the event known as Summer Davos in China this week, with companies rethinking their strategies to mitigate the impact of tensions between China and the West.
title: ‘Summer Davos’ Highlights Corporate Anxiety Over Global Tariffs

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said his country needs to do more than just filing diplomatic protests against China, following the latest confrontation in the South China Sea.
title: Marcos Says Philippines Must Go Beyond Protest After China Clash

description: South Korea plans to launch a 5 trillion won ($3.6 billion) fund to reduce its dependence on foreign supplies as it seeks to safeguard supply chains that have been increasingly disrupted by geopolitical tensions.
title: South Korea Plans Fund to Safeguard Supply Chains as Risks Rise

description: South Korea’s military accused North Korea of using “deception and exaggeration” to cover up a missile that exploded in the early stages of flight on Wednesday.
title: South Korea Doubts North’s Claim of Multiple Warhead Success
